reviews.body: First off let me state that I have NEVER dropped or spilled liquid on my phone. I had mine for less than 3 months and now I have vertical lines going through a very dim screen (allegedly this is a known issue). Phone periodically reboots and freezes for no reason. Wi-Fi connection is spotty at best. Maybe I got a lemon as most review are positive (which is why I bought this). However, I will NEVER buy another Motorola product. Back to LG or Samsung.

reviews.name: Toni M.
reviews.body: I think for such a budget phone the moto E 2nd generation is a fantastic phone for its price. It comes with android lollipop 5.0. And it has LTE which most budget phones don't as far as for the price and value. And the text and colors on the screen is very sharp and pretty crisp. I'd recommend this phone to anyone on a budget who doesn't need all the specs and someone who just is looking for a good phone.

reviews.name: Dad of 4
reviews.body: I'm giving it a full 5 stars because of the features vs cost - if I was going on phone alone I'd probably go with 4 stars. I don't want to spend a huge amount of money for a phone or have a long lasting contract. Some pros and cons Pros: cost, Lollipop 5, long battery life, stripped down Android, nice size, strong signal, 4G LTE, front facing camera that I can use with Skype, nice speed - but I'm comparing with a Galaxy S 3 Cons: locked bootloader that cannot be unlocked, unable to root (probably more a function of lollipop), no NFC, 8GB vs 16Gb of internal memory - just make sure to get an SD card and move apps to the SD card that allow for it - I have a good number of the popular apps and still have 1GB free

reviews.name: Wilchbla
reviews.title_review: Don't waste your money with this cheap piece of junk
reviews.body: Don't waste your money with this cheap piece of junk. There's a reason Motorola is going under. Bad products, bad management, bad customer service and bad company policies. This junk almost immediately began to have problems with the microphone. At first I assumed it was something to do with my signal thinking no way something that LOOKS so nice could actually be such a piece of junk. Sure enough, after two months of seldom use the microphone finally gave out. I tried blowing it out with canned air and even doing a factory reset, but nope. Fortunately I purchased a protection plan for it when I bought it at Chinamart but all they did was give me the number for Motorola. The man in India whom I had to repeat my name five times to and still insisted my first name was really my last name told me that if I sent them $125.00 dollars they would then send me a new phone which I'd probably receive in about a month's time (being it was India) and then after I sent them my old phone back (another month) he would then reimburse me $100.00 dollars. I paid $60.00 for it at Chinamart. Don't waste your time with any product made at the soon to be out of business Motorola Corp. unless you like to contribute to some obese CEO's golden parachute. UPDATE: After finally giving in and sending the phone to get repair it was sent back but lasted about a month before issues with the battery draining and the phone boot looping began. Apparently, from what one of the salesmen at Verizon told me is that Motorola has been having problems with many of their phones batteries malfunctioning. Supposedly this issue has been cleared up with their latest models but there never was a recall on all the bad models. So I have sent the phone back a second time to be repair. Whether they fix it is another issue. Needless to say I will never buy Motorola again.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.body: I bought a brand new sandisk memory card for it[32gb]. I formatted it correctly and installed. The memory card doesn't allow for extra apps, just pictures and videos. This phone was meant to be a replacement for my moto e. It is somehow worse. The final straw for me was when it decided that I removed my memory card.... 2 times a day or more. Which causes my amazon music app to crash. It always shows 500 mbs of free space, yet I don't have enough space for a 13mb app. This is by far the worst phone I have owned.

reviews.name: GaryTucson
reviews.title_review: A nice entry-level phone that wasn't good enough to replace my Razr M (Motorola Luge)
reviews.body: This is a nicely built, decently spec'd entry-level device. I decided I would try one at Best Buy, on their 14 day trial period, to see if it would make a good replacement or back-up phone for the Motorola Luge (Razr M) I've been using for the last three months on Verizon's pre-paid plan. The first thing I noticed about it was that it was MUCH more difficult to customize than the Luge was. I'm not sure if it was the new Lollipop OS, or the proprietary Moto stuff, or the pre-loaded Google Launcher, but it wouldn't correctly run any of the notification reminder apps in the play store (I have found them to be essential for not missing calls and text messages), or my beloved Moto Circles widget. In addition, they kind of force you to merge all of your email accounts into the Gmail app on this thing, and it was very hard to figure out how to keep my email accounts separate, the way I like them, and still get notifications of them as they arrive. On top of that, it doesn't come with a stock video player, forcing you to download and install a 3rd party app if you don't want to use the limited gallery app to watch videos. I was also surprised to find a 5MP camera with limited zoom ability and no auto focus, when my Razr M (a year older phone) came with an 8MP one with great zoom and auto-focus, and the front-facing camera for selfies on this thing was a joke. In keeping with all the other disappointments, even with what they call a "1.2 GHz QUAD core processor" in this Moto E 2nd Gen, it was no faster than my 1.5 GHz DUAL-core Razr M. In fact, my Razr M located me, drew the map and started navigation faster than the Moto E did, and everything I looked up on both devices came in just as quickly on the Razr M, or faster, than it did on the Moto E. I DID like the way Lollipop stays active with Google Now and the "OK Google" thing while you're on the home screen, but apparently any phone running the new Android OS does that, so this ONE better thing about this phone certainly wasn't enough to justify the $69.99 price when I only paid $49.99 for the Razr M, so I returned it within the 14 day grace period and will continue to enjoy my Motorola Luge until they come out with something considerably better around this price. This cute little Moto E was a real disappointment compared to the Luge, or my other device, the Samsung Galaxy S4 Zoom (which I LOVE as a fantastic camera that also works pretty nicely as a phone on AT&T's MUCH poorer network). Bottom line? If you're looking for a fairly inexpensive entry-level phone and haven't fallen in love with certain things about your current phone (like the cool Circles Widget, Notification Reminders, LED notification capability, decent camera, stock video app, etc., etc., etc.) you might just find this phone to your liking, especially at this $69.99 price on Verizon's INCREDIBLE network and very reasonably priced, pre-paid plans.

reviews.name: Galen Anderson
reviews.title_review: Nicely designed hardware; poor photographic capabilities.
reviews.body: Hardware Design; the phone feels and looks good. The textured removable edge and the matte black rear of the phone feel good to hold. A small dimple at the Motorola logo helps you to keep a good grip on the phone. This is actually one of the nicest feeling phones I have ever held, it fits in my hands well and its easy to grip one handed and touch every part of the screen. The visual aesthetics are well thought out too, there are no visible slots for sim or SD and the phone is entirely black. Its nearly symmetrical except for the power button and the volume up/dn which are both on the right side. The power button has a texture which helps you know you are pressing what you want. There are no other physical buttons.The headphone port is centered on the top of the phone. There is no text on the exterior of the device, but the Motorola, Verizon, and 4G LTE logos are all on the back. A black rubberized ring wraps the outer edge of the phone, you can snap this off to reveal the micro SD card slot, the SIM card slot and the tag that is on a little pull label (this was seriously unexpected and kind of fun). The battery is non-removable. It charges via micro USB. Battery: I dont use the phone that much, but I go through maybe 40-50% in a day. Unless you are using it constantly, it should last most people a full day. Camera: Barely useable. Works fine outside on a sunny day, but indoors you get very grainy blurry photos. It doesn't focus very well. Selfie-cam, forget it. If the back facing camera is bad, the front one is terrible. OS and Software: The OS is Android 5.0.2 Lollipop. It's not as good as Jelly Bean or Kit Kat but because this is a Motorola phone you can hope that updates will come quickly. Motorola and Verizon have some bloatware, but its not acceptable. Verizon Messages is surprisingly good. Comes with an FM radio app. All email now goes through Gmail; which takes some getting used to. The Camera and Gallery apps are as bad as the hardware. Seriously, if you need a proper camera phone, this is not for you. For under $100 unlocked, this is a good deal, its likely that it will hold its value for quite a while on the second hand market.

reviews.name: J's SW
reviews.title_review: Verizon? How about any GSM network?
reviews.body: Got it for $10 at a Best Buy during a sale. I then went home and found out you can unlock these bad boys to use with any GSM network. Took me no more then half an hour to figure it all out and got me straight onto the T-Mobile network! Thanks XDA forums!

reviews.name: Tessa Zigler
reviews.body: Bought Moto E when my Moto G got slam dunked into the ground a couple months ago. Unfortunately other then being 4G and having a little bit more customization it has been a bad purchase. There is no flash on this model so that also means no flashlight, which is nice at times, the battery dies super fast, it's constantly glitching or freezing and the speaker/microphone barely works. And when I first got it had trouble with the sim card actually staying in. I wouldn't recommend buying.

reviews.name: james
reviews.title_review: I like the size and style of the moto phones
reviews.body: was ok until the antenna stopped working and it wouldnt read my sim card anymore. I like the size and style of the moto phones. to bad the moto g is 3g only it is a better build quality

reviews.name: Kurt and Meghan Hennes
reviews.title_review: After digging memory issues for a while I'd like to share a useful bit
reviews.body: This is my second moto e and I'm replacing due to broken screen. After digging memory issues for a while I'd like to share a useful bit. Do not get class 10 32gb sd cards. I've gone thru a couple and they eventually erase themselves. Only get class 4 on the 32gb and u shouldn't have a problem;

reviews.name: Ty H.
reviews.body: There's a reason this phone is so cheap. It crashes, it randomly stops reading the SIM card, it's missing little things that are expected like an MP3 player and the ability to use your own file as an alarm. It also lacks a good alarm, because if you let it sit for a minute instead of doing what most alarms would do, go off until you turn them off, it will turn itself off. If you're like me and are a deep sleeper, this alarm will auto-snooze for you. I've almost missed a few very important events because of this phone. It will also take a good 20-30 seconds to start the alarm, so if you set a timer on the phone for 2 minutes then it won't start going off until 2 and a half minutes.

reviews.name: AJ
reviews.title_review: ... had a problem with it yet the touchscreen is great there is about 4gb free memory which for this ...
reviews.body: I got this phone a month ago and I never had a problem with it yet the touchscreen is great there is about 4gb free memory which for this prise it is great it has a 4.5 inch screen and I got a free case with it was a great buy

reviews.name: Cyndi Daniels
reviews.title_review: But all in all a good phone.
reviews.body: Decent phone. Way too many aps on it for me and when trying to uninstall them, find out they affect others I wanted to keep. But all in all a good phone.

reviews.name: Barry
reviews.title_review: Verizon and Motorola -- a deadly combo
reviews.body: I also bought one of these from a Verizon storefront with a prepay service, and it's a piece of junk. The phone has serious problems: 1. Twice, I had trouble getting the phone to answer a call, and when the audio finally connected, it was at earsplitting volume. Because both these occurred while answering, it was annoying enough that I don't exactly remember the sequence. I refuse to experiment to pin down the sequence that would allow me to reproduce the problem because I refuse to risk damage to my hearing. My ears are still buzzing from the last time, and will go to the doctor if it doesn't clear soon. (And i live in the city and am not finicky about noise) 2. The bluetooth system doesn't reliably connect -- and this may be be related to problem No. 1. This is bluetooth headset I've used with another cheap prepay phone from another carrier without issue. 3. The software has a serious problem in the phone app. The dialer icon often sits over a contact either in Speed dial tab or in the recent calls tab. But I often use to the dialer to punch in numbers and tapping the dialer icon often dials the number under the icon while at the same time raising the dialer keypad. It's a software problem and I suspect this is Verizon at work, but it could be Google and the constantly changing android interfaces. Anyway, I can cope with this by keeping the speed dial as clear as possible, so the the dialer icon is isolated. When I went to the Verizon storefront, I got a snotty clerk, who found it necessary to tell me, "This is a smartphone and you got to learn to use it." So Verizon has picked my pocket one time, but I'd never sign up for a regular plan with the company.

reviews.name: Z
reviews.title_review: It is a nice phone, but mine has a serious problem
reviews.body: I bought a Moto E from a Verizon walk-in store. It is a nice phone, but mine has a serious problem. Sometimes I cannot hear people on the other end. and sometimes they cannot hear me. The problem is intermittent and because a store employee cannot replicate it as its recurrence is unpredictable, they won't swap-out my phone. I have noticed this complaint elsewhere from Moto E owners on the web and it seems to be the single serious complaint. Obviously most Moto E phones don't have the problem. Mine does. Until Motorola issues a product defect notice I cannot swap mine out at the Verizon store. I will only say buyer beware.

reviews.name: moheganer2
reviews.body: sim card did not work.piece of junk.

reviews.name: miquilena alberto
reviews.body: I love it

reviews.name: ander498
reviews.body: This phone is simply an updated 1st gen Moto G (identical size, shape, feel, buttons) but with a serious flaw: the call quality is terrible. Really terrible. Why? This isn't a real phone most of the time, it forces you to call with "HD calling" - better known as VOIP. Every call sounds like you are in Skype... possibly across a major ocean. And because it uses the data connection, you can't use data while you are in the phone, and drops the call every time you lose LTE.. welcome back to 2006. There is no way to turn off this "feature" or more broadly to turn off LTE without rooting the phone. Simply put, it's a terrible phone. If you don't use your phone for.. well.. phone calls, it could be a good fit for the price, features, etc. Other than that, "HD Calling" kills what could have been a good budget phone.

reviews.name: Clint Wirth
reviews.body: WONDERFUL!!!!!!

reviews.name: scott boardwine
reviews.title_review: amazon rip off, go to walmart
reviews.body: I bought this at Walmart for 70 bucks, idky amazon is so expensive.. But its a great phone for the price..

reviews.name: Cliente de Amazon
reviews.body: El problema es q yo pedí un teléfono desbloqueado para usarlo con cualquier compañía pero ya lo intenté con todas y con ninguna me da red, osea no lo puedo utilizar.

reviews.name: Cliente de Amazon
reviews.body: Nunca me llego ni me reembolsaron mi dinero hace 2 meses de eso y nada no dan solución no lo recomiendo

title_item: Nokia Lumia 635 8GB Unlocked GSM 4G LTE Windows 8.1 Quad-Core Smartphone - Black

reviews.name: tesg
reviews.title_review: Arrived Carrier Locked, but Seller Quickly Resolved
reviews.body: I selected a seller offering a used model in "Very Good" condition for $49.95 (JP Mobiles LLC) and, like many reviewers, ended up with a carrier locked phone. But the seller had me the unlock code within a day of me contacting them, and all is well. The handset arrived bubble-wrapped in a generic box with a mini USB charging cable and a Samsung plug adapter. All worked fine and were in excellent condition. The handset looks like a new out-of-the-box piece with no blemishes and functions perfectly. The Lumia 635 looks better in person than in pictures with its Gorilla Glass face and black shell. It has no physical buttons, so the entire face is just the glass and the edge of the rear shell. Sitting on my desk, it looks like a fine piece of tinted glass, uniformly dark. Even the NOKIA logo is barely visible. It attracts fingerprints easily, but they wipe off just as easily. Really nice looking. It's larger than an iPhone 5S but probably a tiny bit smaller than an iPhone 6. I really like the Windows Phone UI. It's easily and broadly customizable and flows well. I really like how I can add tiles not just to programs, but to specific pages. I have four MSN Weather tiles set at the top of my feed for four different cities, so when I open the main screen, I can see the current temperature for each city immediately. There are negatives. Screen resolution and the processor are mid-tier quality at best. There are far better camera phones out there. My car radio won't recognize it and play music when plugged into the USB port. App support is terrible, of course, but Facebook and Twitter are on board. I'm using the handset as a secondary test phone at work, so that's all fine, but this phone could never be my daily driver. If your data usage is limited to Facebook, Twitter, and web browsing, this is a fine handset available at a tremendous value compared to Android and Apple products. And you'll have something that stands out over your friends' handsets.

reviews.name: Bank Of America
reviews.title_review: It's Too Good To Be True
reviews.body: I'm in LOVE with the camera on this phone! Pictures don't come out fuzzy even when you crop or zoom in, it automatically focuses pretty darn good with "close-ups"! I use it a lot with taking many pictures of items for sale on Ebay. But I don't know what's wrong with the "phone" and windows? I keep buying this phone just because of the CAMERA and just needing a simple "phone" and it works great for about 6 months and issues begin to happen. Right now the message feature will lock up after one word, so my messages to be able to send Iwouldneedtowriteitlikethis all together without spaces to be able to send it. The battery charge is only lasting like 3-5hrs when it use to last all day and the voice is sometimes not able to understand, either intermittent seconds of cut off or sounding muzzled but I don't know if that's the service or the phone. The camera feature is now locking up sometimes... This phone would be "too good to be true" if it would just last longer! The camera feature does work amazing for a long time until now over a year. I'd give it a 5+ star for the first 6 months of working great but it's just too good to be true, for it starts to die after that and it's why I gave it a 2 star. I'm already looking at other cellphones again but trying them out always brings me back to considering to buying this one AGAIN for a 3rd time! =( There's NOTHING out there that can compare, maybe if I put insurance on it, I can keep trading in for a new one every 6 months? IDK, this is so frustrating!

reviews.name: S. Young
reviews.title_review: Windows Phone Surprises; But is Sold Without Factory Reset
reviews.body: Surprisingly nice phone from Windows (who knew?). If you are an Android user, and are looking for a change, and don't completely hate Windows 8.1, this phone will surprise you. It is fast, responsive, and sleek. Has a nice, "real" feel in hand. Again, very surprising purchase. But (and this will frighten you), this phone did not come factory reset. It was synced to a user's email, revealing their banking information, name, LinkedIn job searches, and so on. Very scary. The Internet can be a dangerous place when your personal information is available this easy. Note to Amazon (who fulfilled the order), and the seller: You need to be very careful when selling Window's devices that have not been factory reset -- or any device for that matter. Had we been different people, we could have ruined this poor person's life all because of your negligence.

reviews.name: Tony Sandos
reviews.body: I bought this phone in July 2016. I was undoubtedly worried that there was a catch to the low price for this phone. It arrived on time, worked as expected and I have suffered no issues since having it. Disclaimer: I have dropped it a few times. It still works dependably and I haven't seen any mechanical errors yet. The windows phone operating system is great. It compliments my windows tablet very well and has a cozy design. The features are easy to find and there's rarely endless and confusing sub-menus like iphones. Minor complaints: It doesn't seem to dim enough at night when I'm using it in the dark or brighten enough on the sunniest southern summer days. The screen came with a very small area that was scratched and the screen seems to scratch somewhat easily, but is still very easy to view. I'll probably buy Nokia phones from now on

reviews.name: Robert Dares
reviews.body: Can't get much better than this for a budget phone. Fast and smooth with a quad core. Not many phones out there with quad cores at this price. Memory was 512mb and listed as being expandable but further research indicates you wouldn't want to expand onto an SD card as it would become slower. That was my original intention, but it runs smoothly with 512mb of RAM and doesn't need an upgrade (I'm also not one to play graphic heavy games on my phone as I'll leave that for my desktop). File system is not quite the same as android. For each file windows associates that file with a program and won't show up in file searches. I added music files to the phone and wanted to add them as ringtones, but found I had to do a bit of a workaround to get my own custom ringtones on there. Msft provided steps to do it and it worked out just fine (just not as convenient as android). Battery life is good and goes about 2 days -2.5 days and I play a lot of candy crush. Camera is "Okay". No camera on front, but for what I use it for, I don't need one (don't do video chats or take selfies). I upgraded to windows 10 but couldn't stand it and reverted back to windows 8. Cortana didn't work and forced to move towards the outlook app which was inconvenient with 2 emails. Also found Windows 10 browser didn't run as smoothly as the windows 8 version and things just were not intuitively simple (i.e. where my fingers wanted to go was not where they had to go). Having gone back to windows 8.1 I'm loving it again and love the customization of times and layout of email.

reviews.name: professorbrendo
reviews.body: Phone works great. I got this for someone who has never used a touch phone before and it is a wonderful smart phone for a first time user. They can explore the phone capabilities easily and make things as big or small as they like. The interface is easy to understand for someone who has never used a touch phone before and so they can get as technical as they like but this doesn't make it boring for a more advanced user. Great battery life and it's a durable phone. I will say this model is starting to not support the newest windows phone software though because it is an older model. (But hey why get a really expensive phone for a brand new smart phone user who only wants to use phones for calling,) but I am happy with this Nokia and am willing to keep buying new Nokias in the future.

reviews.name: Joseph Ruggiero, Jr.
reviews.title_review: Good for mobile calling, apps are sparse due to EOL
reviews.body: Since Microsoft has abandoned Windows Mobile, these phones have been a bit of a novelty. If you search online, there are ways to get the phone updated to the latest (read 10) release, but I just use the phone as a burner for calling, and testing mobile services. For that, it serves its purpose.

reviews.name: Eli O.
reviews.body: I bought this for my boyfriend who works construction after destroying or losing multiple Samsung Note III. He has a tendency to drop his phone at his worksite from multiple stories high or from scissor lifts. The Nokia Lumina is compact to safely carry in his pocket and fast enough for him not to miss his note III so much. He says it is not nearly as fast but it's fast enough. It is half the size and inexpensive enough for him to replace as regularly. He did cut the amount of apps he installs on his phone to optimize speed. He still continues to lose or drop his phone. Now if I could just find a way to secure his phone to his pocket...maybe a pocket watch chain.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.body: Phone seems to be working well. Conversations (voice sounds) are clear for both people involved.in a conversation, the phone makes a wonderful ipod substitute when used without a sim card. Nitpicks- there does not seem to be a way to set different volumes for ring tone and conversation, and the steps involved in making calls are more complex than elderly persons used to messaging phones would like. This particular 'feature' seems common to all smart phones. The phone -was- unlocked, as advertised, which was necessary. This phone will get Windows 10.. I've not tried the phone out where towers are an hour or more apart yet, nor have I tried it out in mountainous country.

reviews.name: Animal Lover
reviews.body: Refurbished so I expected it to work well but it gives me trouble on and off. Trouble in terms of dropping out going calls, many times it won't send my text messages and there are times I have learned of missed calls coming in which isn't good when you use this as your only phone. I realize I saved some money on getting the refurbished model to replace my original but am now thinking I have to spend the money to get something that would be really reliable on a consistent basis. I don't blame the folks who refurbished it because it probably worked for them when testing it out.

reviews.name: Becca
reviews.title_review: Nokia Lumia 635 - Very nice phone, would recommend
reviews.body: This is very nice phone compared to my prior phone (samsung). Windows 8.1 is very nice and easy to use with tiles. Apps included are very nice and ease of use of menus is fantastic. WiFi connectivity is flawless and have had no issue using browser with no slow down. Battery life is at least 2-3 days with limited internet/apps usage/e reader usage. Note: this did not include videos or games so cannot offer details regarding battery life usage using these (yet). Using phone on a Straighttalk plan and only some issues with outgoing text attachments not being received by other phone subscribers (t-mobile). This is a phone SIM setting issue and not problem with phone itself. Overall I would highly recommend to the person that is new to smartphones for ease of windows tiles.

reviews.name: Gemdreamer
reviews.title_review: Great beginner phone for the money.
reviews.body: I purchased this phone for my 14 year old niece who was using a pre-paid tracphone. Like many teenagers, it took her about 3.5 seconds to learn all there was to learn to use the phone like a pro. She was already texting by the time I had my phone turned on. She liked the smaller size and found the windows operating system to be very easy to use. I showed her where she could get additional apps and she seemed pretty pleased with the variety. This phone worked right out of the box and once the sim card was added, she was off and running. Great beginner phone for the money.

reviews.name: Michael Mach
reviews.body: I am pretty tough on phones and typically do not keep them in a case. I just cracked the screen on my second Lumia. I need a basic smartphone for work: text messaging, phone, email and calendaring as critical. Occasional Spotify and podcasts. For the price you really cannot beat this. Yes, the screen is somewhat dim, the hardware specs are pretty low, but again, look at the price. I used to have a Lumia 920, 820 and now this 635. Setup was easy, simply replace SIM as I did, or swap one out of the old phone as indicated by the AT$T store. Cheers!

reviews.name: Lisa B
reviews.title_review: Offers quite a bit and is easy to use.
reviews.body: In a family with 4 smart phones, it seems like one of them is always breaking. The last time mine died, I spent $450 on an emergency replacement because I need a phone for my job and I didn't have time to shop around. After that, I purchased this phone to have on hand as a family "back up phone". Three of us have now used it to cover us while we replaced our primary phones and it works great. It would not be my preference for my primary phone because it doesn't have all the features I prefer, but it offers quite a bit and is easy to use.

reviews.name: Jak Hammer
reviews.body: May be a 5 star if the possible upgrade to Win 10 down the road is possible with the limits AT&T put on their version of this model. Wish I knew what bloat wear to delete. What a shame AT&T castrated their version of this phone. But, What a Value at the price we got. We can make and receive calls again as the local towers were ignoring our old phones, and we can now see to do the texts that my spouses job had begun to require. We bought two of these from different sellers. One to get my spouse a working and text capable phone again, and the second when we saw how well it worked. The first purchase included a photocopied? and unreadable manual, and although sold as new had some minor wear and missing paperwork that made me think is was a pristine return or factory recon. The second phone was perfect.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.title_review: ... I use(d - now on W10) so it was easy for me to understand
reviews.body: This phone mirrors W8 that I use(d - now on W10) so it was easy for me to understand. I really don't have anything bad to say about the phone but I am a little disappointed that it only has one camera - no forward facing camera - I'm not big into selfies anyway! But performance is everything expected and battery life is great - I can go 2 or 3 days without having to charge, but I'm not a heavy user. If you want a cheap, easy to use Windows phone and are not into 'selfies' then this could work for you.

reviews.name: David Harrison
reviews.body: If you’re into tech and want to experience windows phone, via to do some creative things this works well. By today’s standards it’s out of date but still fun to mess around with

reviews.name: Marie
reviews.body: I received this phone yesterday and love it so far! I love how the picture is so clear. I like that it is a little bigger than my last phone. I was a bit worried when I saw all this stuff about AT&T when I first got the phone yesterday but I popped my SIM card in from my previous phone and it works. (I have tmobile) I also love how easy it is to take pics and I have already figured out how to take 2 pics and post them side by side on facebook!

reviews.name: Mike C
reviews.title_review: First I should say the phone is great. The hole is using this phone with Windows ...
reviews.body: First I should say the phone is great. The hole is using this phone with Windows 8.1 connected to Consumer Cellular (who uses the AT&T network). MMSC is riddled with problems. Multiple service calls with CC since they are the only ones with whom I can speak have yielded nothing. I can do everything with this phone except MMSC messaging. After many settings changes, resets (my phone and with CC) nothing works. The forums are awash in others with the same problem and with various claims of success which all don't agree with each other. Many statements of "these are the settings that work" but disagreement reigns. Some commenters are ready to set fire to Microsoft or somebody others to give their phones back. Nobody seems to implicate AT&T whose network is being used. So great phone but unless you have some magic pixi dust, a service like I have will prevent you from enjoying MMSC and grandkid photos. Have to use email instead.

reviews.name: DM5
reviews.title_review: Good phone but discovered too late that a screen protector ...
reviews.body: Good phone but discovered too late that a screen protector comes already applied to the phone. Not bad but the protector is easily scratched by contact with even the inside of a pocket. Not knowing it was only a protector (looked like it had a bout with sandpaper), I sent it back for an exchange. Luckily the merchant was Wireless Experts who I highly recommend. They were prompt and responsive to my concerns. Even after they diagnosed the problem with the screen protector, they sent a replacement phone. I would recommend removing the protector as well as the easily removed plastic sheet that protects the screen during shipping; .... and of course ordering a quality screen protector for the lumia 635.

reviews.name: A. Ramsey
reviews.title_review: The Nokia Lumia 635 Will Meet Your Exectations
reviews.body: I just received the Nokia Lumia 635 smartphone so I have not finished evaluation. One criticism is that the applications are of a very "proprietary nature" so that only those allowed by Windows may be installed. I wish there were more freedom of choice other than the app store provided. Also, if one is on a limited budget (prepaid) then you will want to switch-off many of the apps as these require minutes. So far, the Nokia Lumia 635 meets expectations. It did ship, on time and set-up was easy after I requested configurations settings from my network carrier.

reviews.name: XD·PX
reviews.body: Loved it- if you could only still get service for it!

reviews.name: Dany
reviews.title_review: It's very basic smartphone but it's good for the price
reviews.body: It's unlocked but just basic smartphone, wifi works but slow, texting is hard due to small keyboard, I have been using Iphone and recently Blu ,i was ok but I found Nokia wierd. it doesn't have most mobile apps:ITunes and google play do, it very inconsistent to download apps.it looks very fragile it's good for that price

reviews.name: de_geaba
reviews.title_review: So far after few weeks is very good product for the price paid
reviews.body: So far very responsive phone. It is a gift so I will come back with more details when available. So far after few weeks is very good product for the price paid .

reviews.name: CFernandez
reviews.body: love my phone. but call blocking should be able to do w/o having to go to history of calls or messages.should be able to do right in settings. camera should have flash and front lens. should also be able to use your music as ringtone w/o having to add any apps. and send a readable copy of the handbook. one I received was a bad copy. wasn't clear couldn't read it. phones made in last 5 yrs should all come with front n back lenses and flash.

reviews.name: Yelly
reviews.body: excellent phone Although there were problems with sending amazon solved the problem. I must say that the phone is great. it's fast. Photos are very decent for 5mp. the trouble is that no flash. The Windows operating system is not bad. But it lacks to compete with the Android operating system. I can say that the phone works for Latin America. to Venezuela movistar works for 2g-3g-4g LTE. for Movilnet 2g-3g-H +. To digitel Only 2g or E, does not raise 3g.

reviews.name: Danfodio
reviews.title_review: I am outside of the country and could not even ...
reviews.body: I am outside of the country and could not even use the phone at all. I just keep getting no sim or invalid sim card message regardless of what kind of sim I tried to use. This phone is supposed to be unlock and ready to be used with gsm carriers. I just bought a messed up and cannot even replace it.

reviews.name: PJD
reviews.title_review: This little phone is my first smart phone and I do love it
reviews.body: I ordered this phone and a Nokia 920. I have lost so many cell phones that now I want to have 1 in my purse and leave 1 here at the house. Maybe then I can keep track of at least 1 of them. This little phone is my first smart phone and I do love it. I am just now learning how to operate all the bells and whistles. However compared to the much more expensive and feature loaded 920, this 635 has turned out to be the better phone: this immediately recognized my home wifi network. When I put the SIM card in from Consumer Cellular, I was immediately able to make calls. Cortona worked the first time I set it up. The screen is bright, the signal is strong and so far I am pleased ! The 920 is another story: no wifi connection at my house, did not recognize my SIM card (this is a HUGE problem per Google) and even after downloading updates on my neighbor's wifi, still no Cortona despite 8.1 being downloaded. I gave up and am returning it. So I bought another 635 as my backup phone. Hope it works as well as the first one I have !

reviews.name: david cepeda
reviews.title_review: pictured in size compared with the Nokia X3-02
reviews.body: Excellent phone, load applications seamlessly, accept without problems dela line chip and 4G up the connection with W wifi is excellent, the camera is perfect .. I recommend a good phone

reviews.name: Lon Adams
reviews.body: The price was hard to resist. I thought I would be getting a low quality phone, but it is amazing! The speaker on my other phones have been difficult to hear with the sound being hard at times to understand, especially if the person on the other end speaks without a lot of enunciation. With this, the sound is great at mid volume, the speaker is clear and it is easy to use. It has features that I wasn't expecting and would rather pay for this phone than buy the jacked up prices other phones cost. The battery is long. I can go a few days without charging and I don't need to worry about playing a movie on it and then find a place to charge it. I also like the Windows base instead of Android or Apple. I wish the Windows version was closer to the laptop windows version, but close enough that I can use the same files. I bought a case for it and I have people asking me what brand it is. I recommend it wholeheartedly.

reviews.name: Jessica McCarthy
reviews.body: Seems ok. Had it about a week now. Fast and all the same features as the 1520 I previously had. The alarm wouldn't shut off this morning.. I had to pull the battery out to shut it up! Let's hope this isn't the beginning of a troubled electronic

reviews.name: J. Burton Williams
reviews.title_review: My son paid for it himself and would do it again!!!!
reviews.body: This is my son's phone it replaced an earlier model from Nokia. He really prefers the Microsoft Windows experience enough that he paid for the upgrade to this phone himself. Indorsement: He says that he would do it again, He really likes this phone and its durable!!!

reviews.name: JMS-SAS
reviews.title_review: Refund needed now or seller has ripped off an elderly woman. I will edit if we're satisfied with resolution.
reviews.body: I bought (helped her purchase with her card) this for my 71 year old mom, who has used a Windows phone for years and fully understands how they work. She was excited to get a new one. However, it's been a horrible phone and a waste of money. It's "open" but really NOT. It doesn't work well with TMobile, it has preloaded stuff on it that is causing problems. She's on limited income and NEEDS A REFUND!!! She tried so hard to make it work, she went past the 1 month return policy but I feel if she doesn't get a FULL REFUND she's being taken advantage of and I will keep complaining. I have a 635, same phone, I bought it at a Microsoft store and it was truly "unlocked." (3 years ago, appx). Mine and hers are NOTHING alike. Hers is a mess, confusing, has weird apps. The Cortana which she loved to use isn't functioning much at all. The GPS directions feature has failed her and she's been lost trying to get to see her grandkids play sports games around the metro. The T-Mobile people are saying she needs to throw it out and get a better phone. But I have one and it's working fine. It's the product that this seller sold us that is the problem.

reviews.name: EH
reviews.body: works okay

reviews.name: Lily2012
reviews.title_review: It is an AT&T locked phone! Don't buy!
reviews.body: I bought this phone as an unlocked phone for my sister as a gift and now she can't use it. It is supposed to be an unlocked phone but it is an AT&T go phone instead and doesn't work with any other carrier. I am very disappointed.

reviews.name: Helen Bradley
reviews.title_review: Great Phone - Well worth the price
reviews.body: Awesome phone. Unlocked and Windows 8.1 installed. I had to reset the phone when it arrived to be able to log into my Microsoft account and the printed manual was printed so badly it was illegible. But the important part - the phone itself - works great.

reviews.name: R. G.
reviews.title_review: A smart phone that has all the bells and whistles that ...
reviews.body: A smart phone that has all the bells and whistles that I need. The fact that it's inexpensive makes all the more worth it. Even though it states AT&T version, this doesn't matter as my mobile carrier is T Mobile and this phone works great.

reviews.name: Thunder Cloud
reviews.body: This is a nice little smart phone. It does what you need, and does it well. It's not as developed as a Lumia 1520, as there is no flash for the camera, no capacity to use the compass app (but the map function works), and no equalizer for the music player. But I find the call, email and text functions to be superb.

reviews.title_review: Nice little phone but has its flaws

Finally I updated to Win 10 and things got better. It's still not perfect but the final version of Win 10 hasn't been released yet. Battery lasts over a day but I'm not a power user. The phone has only 512 MB of RAM but is pretty responsive none the less. No visible lag so far. Other than that Windows 10 is fun to use and I can do almost anything I could do with my Android phone.

reviews.name: Dr. Dan
reviews.title_review: Excellent starter/replacement phone for the money... just one big flaw...
reviews.body: When my wife's iPhone 4S did battle with the sidewalk (and lost), we were in need of a replacement phone for not a lot of cash. Fortunately, my brother-in-law had this phone and needed to switch carriers, so he gave us his Lumia 635. She has been using it now for four or five months with absolutely no problems. The build is light but not flimsy, the performance is quick, the camera takes acceptable pictures (so long as you have good lighting), and it does absolutely everything that my wife was doing with her iPhone 4S... with one exception: the lack of a camera FLASH. For my wife, this is a pretty big sore spot, because she likes using her phones' flash as a flashlight. She has told me repeatedly that were it not for this issue, she would have zero issues with this device. If lack of a flash (and flashlight) mean little to you, then this is a no-brainer. If you DO want a flash and better specs, the newer Lumia 640 (this phone's replacement) is better-equipped, but costs a bit more.

reviews.name: Avid Amazoner
reviews.title_review: We decided to try it out for a few days just to be sure he was going to like it before we dropped his phone from Verizon and ...
reviews.body: I got this phone for my son who's going to Europe this summer. He's had a regular phone on our Verizon family plan but, after some investigation, I found out that their international plan is ridiculous. So...I researched the GoPhone, found out he can just exchange the sim card for one he can purchase in each country he visits, and decided to give it a try. I figured if it didn't work out, I was only out $46. The phone arrived in two days, fully packaged (that assured me it wasn't used or refurbished). It comes with a sim card so all you have to do is call and activate it and they give you your new phone number. We decided to try it out for a few days just to be sure he was going to like it before we dropped his phone from Verizon and ported his old number. He absolutely loves it! He keeps saying he can't believe it's a $46 phone! The speed that it loads videos and music is better than my iphone and the call clarity is great! The live tiles are cool, too, and the expandable memory (with a memory card) is going to be great for taking lots of travel pictures. It even has an FM radio which is unique in this day and age. After getting his seal of approval, we decided to drop him from our contract and port his old number. A ten minute phone call and he was good to go. This was, by far, the easiest cell phone experience I've ever had! Side note.....I've had to call AT&T a few times for various things (setting up the phone, porting his old number, and questions about oversees calling.....basic "newbie" things) and I cannot begin to tell you how awesome their customer service is! The people are easily understood, very friendly, and my longest wait was when they ported the old number and I had to stay on the line while we waited for the Verizon operator to do what he needed to do (rolling my eyes). A few things to note: This phone cannot be used with Verizon. If you pay for unlimited data, be aware that it slows down considerably after you've used your 1.5GB. You can still use the data (or wifi, of course) but streaming videos on data is just about impossible at the slower speed. Take care to use wifi as much as possible and it won't be an issue. There is no flash to the camera (which I really don't understand) or front facing camera so selfies will have to be done in bright light with a mirror and skype might be difficult (this doesn't bother my son because he's not a "selfie guy" and he can skype with his laptop). The one thing he found that he wishes he had is more app selections. They're quite limited in comparison to others but It's not enough of an issue to dislike the phone. If you're on the fence about this one, I say go for it! I am so happy I didn't listen to my husband about how prepay is a pain and more expensive. That's simply not true! When my son leaves for Europe, I just won't buy anything for his phone while he's gone and pick back up when he returns. With Verizon, we'd be paying for a service he couldn't use. Also, we can adjust his plan to meet his needs. If he needs more data, we simply buy more for a month. Then, when he starts paying for his own phone, if he can't afford data, he can drop it to talk and text only and just use Wifi when he needs internet. There are just so many options, it seems silly to be under contract.

reviews.name: michael344
reviews.body: As a basic, everyday phone for calls/texting I would give this a 5. It does as expected to that effect, speaker can be decently loud,good for music/YouTube. The cons:(not all these will matter if just want a basic smartphone) on screen keyboard is small and you WILL inadvertently miss type things I promise, no flash for camera(also means no flashlight app),speaking of apps...this is a windows phone...so nothing from Google play works on this (you think that would be common sense considering its not Android but still tried just to make sure). You still get fb and Twitter. No chrome or Firefox you are stuck with internet explorer. Cortana works decently and for some reason understands voice input (corrects better) than if you are voice texting. I have owned this phone for 1 month and recently it has begun to lockup in the middle of youtube(screen goes black)but you can still hear the audio, and can only be remedied by holding the per button until it shuts off and then reset the battery. Again, as a basic cheap possibly entry level smartphone this thing is pretty nice, do not expect its features to outshine a higher end phone

reviews.body: The 635 was a good choice LAST year. It has now been replaced by the FAR superior Microsoft Lumia 640 which has a large five inch screen, dual front and back cameras, 4g LTE for high speed data, and a long life battery. And, the 640 LTE sells for just $60 at your neighborhood AT&T store, and for $40 at your neighborhood MetroPcs store, making it the best cell phone deal of 2015. In December, the 640 will receive a free upgrade to Windows 10 Mobile, the most advanced phone software available. The many 635 owners who have upgraded to the 640 are very, very happy.

reviews.title_review: It's 2017 - and Galaxy S6 Edge / S6 is still the last reliable, high quality Samsung Galaxy cell phone!!
reviews.body: I recently bought this as my second S6 Edge due to battery fires with the S7 and glass cracking complaints with the S8 (plus other S8 design complaints). To me, Samsung's last winner was the S6 & S6 Edge. Nothing after this has interested me. Samsung has lost their ability to produce a well engineered, high quality, and therefore reliable, cell phone. I've had my 1st S6 Edge since October 2015 and not quite two years later in August 2017 I just bought this 2nd one for my wife a few weeks ago. Glad I did. I sure wish manufacturers would put quality FIRST versus trying to out do the other guy with more bells and whistles or stupid ideas that THEY think WE want / need.

reviews.name: Alealan
reviews.body: Was delivered before promised date. Really good condition. Battery holds a charge better than I expected for an older phone.

reviews.name: Lo in LI
reviews.title_review: A good choice for the price (on Amazon)!
reviews.body: This phone is beautiful! It really is cool looking and sleek. The black sapphire looks sparkly blue in the light. REALLY pretty! However, it is VERY slippery in the hand. I was so nervous I'd drop it in the 24 hours before my case arrived ( Galaxy S6 Edge case, E LV Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge (SHOCK PROOF DEFENDER) Slim Case Cover - Impact Protection **NEW**[Black] Ultimate protection from drops and impacts for Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge [BLACK / BLACK ])! I've had the phone for 2 weeks now and all of the functions it advertises work. I'm still figuring some of them out and had the price not been so good on Amazon, I wouldn't have sprung for the edge. The notifications and people functions are cool, but totally unnecessary. The fingerprint scanner was easy to set up to work with multiple fingers (up to 4) and works very well. The backup password is more secure than a typical 4 digit code (had to be at least 8(?) characters),though I haven't had any problems opening the phone with my fingerprint. The heart rate monitor is really cool. I've been checking it at various times of the day and it's cool to see how low (or high!) your heart rate is. Overall, the response to using apps and web pages is fast. It loads webpages really quickly, email was easy to set up and my gmail and hotmail accounts are easy to access from the same icon and I can switch between them with a simple swipe. My work email loads quickly and works as expected as well. The way the email system is set up, it allows you to swipe right or left to get to the next or previous message which I've found rather convenient. So far, the battery is great! I've been warned against "over charging" so I never leave it charging overnight, as I did my previous phone. The fast charging is really super-fast. I'd say it gets a full charge in less than 2 hours. I've charged in the evening prior to going to bed, stopped it at 95% and it was still around 20% the following night with moderate to heavy use (no gaming/video streaming, just talk, text, email, web-surfing). The camera does take very clear shots of stable scenes. Haven't played with the settings or different modes at all yet. Straight auto shooting of moving kids haven't always been clear, but that's more likely due to user error than the fault of the camera. Unless this is also user-error (I haven't looked into it yet) I cannot seem to take a picture directly from a text message. With my old phone I could go into a group message, take a picture and have it automatically attach to the message. If this phone allows that, it isn't an obvious feature. Ditto for simply attaching an existing picture to a message. I have to go into the gallery, pick the picture, add the recipients, and then write a message to send it. Again, this might be a function I haven't figured out yet, but it shouldn't be rocket science to do this. There's usually a little paper clip somewhere in the messaging app that allows attachments. Not so on this phone. I bought a tempered glass protector, but it made it very difficult for the phone to recognize my touch. I ended up removing it as I was too frustrated by it. That may a problem of the protector I chose ( S6 Edge Screen Protector, AOKDO [Full Screen Coverage] Premium Tempered Glass Screen Protector Film for Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge (clear) ) rather than the phone, but my screen is currently naked and I am worried about it breaking as it seems pretty fragile. I will say it is a bit glitchy at times even without the screen protector. I have had issues with it not responding to my touch when I try to scroll up/down or open an application. Not often enough to make me want to return it, but annoying none the less (especially since I chose this phone over another due to the frequency of complaints on reviews of the other phone for this exact issue). I'm hoping it doesn't get worse over time. There is a system update pending, but I haven't allowed it without doing a little research. Maybe that will fix the issue. I believe this is more of a Verizon complaint than specific to the phone, but you cannot do anything else on the phone while speaking to someone. You can't use mobile data to send a text message, use an app, use google maps to get directions, or look something up on the web if you're using the phone/calling function. I read that this is true of all new Verizon phones, but annoying none the less. Overall, I do like the phone a lot. I'd say there are a lot of features that make this a great phone. The minor irritations are just that: minor. All in all a good choice for the price!

reviews.name: Amanda Hartfiel
reviews.body: This phone is amazing! I have yet to find something wrong with it! The system runs great and fast. The camera is amazing. The sides being curved makes it seem sophisticated. I recommend getting a case for this though as it seems like it could break but so far, it hasn't had any dents or scratches with a case on.

The edge screen helps create shortcuts to your favorite apps, top contacts and even allows you to set up shortcuts to execute certain tasks. The battery is not as strong as that of the Samsung Galaxy S6 (non-Edge) but I guess that is the trade off for visual design and feel. The functionality of the light up edge screen based off preset contacts is useful however not a true necessity.
